options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments:
- Use of videos
- Use of workbook and other written materials
Canvas and zoom
The class was also similar to a virtual seminar because there were several activities in break out rooms.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: - Practical French language skills
French!
I started learning French very effectively and quickly.

I gained a significant ability to speak, read, write, and understand French. Though this course is intense in terms of workload, it gave me a significant increase in language skills over a short period of time.
Introduction to French.
I learned how to speak basic French quite well. I also learned how to memorize information more effectively and how to study a large amount of content in a relatively short amount of time.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths:
- Immersion method for language learning
- Small class size
- Attentive prof

Possible improvements:
- Simplify, digitize, and concentrate all study materials and homework in one online app, e.g. Canvas. We had to purchase a print workbook, which is not easy for those studying remotely. This also meant that we had to spend a lot of time each week scanning and sending our workbook assignments to the prof. We also had to deal with too many different materials (workbook, textbook, coursepack, slides, and numerous word docs and PDFs). This situation often generated confusion and diverted student time from actual studies to dealing with bureaucracy.
- Update the learning audiovisual materials. They were produced in the 80s and are not very engaging
- Find a better exam platform. The one we were using kept on producing errors.
I sometimes struggled with some grammar learning. I wish we could have spent a little more time and a little less on the stories but I loved the teacher.

In the first week, I felt lost because of the immersion method. However, as I started to learn and understand, my engagement with the course material increased and I grew to enjoy French. 

Given that we were a small class, maybe some additional in-person elements could be incorporated.
There were a lot of opportunities to practice oral French which helped increase my comfort level with speaking the language. I would have liked quicker feedback for assignments.

Strengths: video material, daily discussions, interesting content and exercises

Weaknesses: online test format (using OWL) is stressful and occasionally does not work super well

Strengths: Well structured for learning. Class was very enjoyable 
Weaknesses: At times, it was hard to receive feedback from grades

I believe the major weakness in this course was the long duration in which it took to receive graded work. Throughout the entire semester, I really had no idea how I was doing in the class. We never received graded tests so I did not know what to fix or improve on until the very end. Our test grades were not revealed until it was time to take our final. As a result, everything we missed on our weekly tests had to be crammed into reading period, making studying less effective in my opinion. If I learned my mistakes when I took the weekly tests, I feel like I could have corrected my mistakes earlier and learned more effectively. 

A large strength of this course is its fairness. The professor is very willing to accommodate the student's needs. She removes assignments that are unreasonable or overwhelming and she removes badly written questions from tests. This makes the students feel as if the professor actually cares for their student's well being, formulating a much stronger and comfortable relationship between student and teacher.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: See comments above.
I liked a lot of the practices in the class of course nothing is the same this semester and would be better if it had been in person.

The main digital learning component that could be improved was the OWL testing system. The automatic recordings and inability to easily navigate the test itself made it sometimes difficult to totally understand what was going on.
I think this course was perfectly structured for the pandemic. Madame Kasje was extremely understanding and reasonable.

I believe lectures were effective in learning, similar to any school year. Since this is a language course, it is essential for students to speak and not just listen. Therefore, I think the course could improve upon student speaking and judging proper pronunciation.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. The benefits outweigh the inconveniences noted above. The prof is also very good.
Yes, it is great!
Yes, anyone who is eager to learn French should take this course.
Yes! If you want to learn a lot of French in a short period of time, then definitely. Just be prepared for a LOT of work, as there are daily exercises and workbook assignments and weekly tests.
Yes, Madame Kasje is a wonderful professor and I genuinely enjoyed the course.

If you are interested in French, I recommend taking this course. The workload can be tough and overwhelming at times, but you truly need this amount of work if you want to be good at the language in a relatively short amount of time. So take this class if you really want to learn French.
